marklogic.body: Liss, it looks like you submitted a pic to the hugging dogs tumbler. I don't know if anyone gave you a heads-up, but it was posted (here's a direct link). The image of Iain napping on the floor next to Dudley reminds me of a conversation I had with a friend waaaay back in high school: Why is it that many animals can their limbs up to sleep comfortably in all kinds of places, but humans' limbs are all pokey-outy and don't fold conveniently?Â  In particular, I'm thinking of cats, who I would swear have retractable legs. In contrast, I try to curl up with my boyfriend at night, and we Always have at least one arm that just doesn't get a comfortable Spot. I mean, if I were to nap on the floor like Iain is in that pic, I'd be all knotted up in the shoulders and neck.
